Bobby Banana Joins LinkedIn: A Fruity Connection! | Dole Skip to main content Open menu Close menu Produce Discover Our Commitment Sustainability Framework Governance, Values and Human Rights Partnerships For Nature‚Äôs Health For an Equitable Future For a Healthier World Company About Dole Our Farms Virtual Farm Tours Open menu Close menu Enter your keywords Apply US US Choose a different Language Close English (United States) Deutsch (Deutschland) English (Canada) English (United Kingdom) Italiano (Italia) Nederlands (Nederland) Greek (Greece) English (United States) Deutsch (Deutschland) English (Canada) English (United Kingdom) Italiano (Italia) Nederlands (Nederland) Greek (Greece) Continue reading Back Heads Up, Corporate Brand Mascots: Dole‚Äôs Bobby Banana is Now on LinkedIn! CHARLOTTE, N.C. (April 16, 2025) FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE Share this post on facebook twitter pinterest email print Dole Food Company mascot selects today‚Äôs National Banana Day to join the world‚Äôs largest career-development social media site But instead of looking for another job, the famous Cavendish banana will use the site to forge digital connection with banana lovers worldwide Most people use LinkedIn to network, build their professional brand and position themselves for their next job by showcasing their skills, experience and education to a wide audience. But as the official healthy-eating mascot of Dole Food Company, Bobby Banana already has the best job: tell the world about the wonders of a diet rich in bananas and other fresh fruits and vegetables. After all, despite being born in the 1990s, the 7-foot Cavendish banana remains farm-fresh, nutrient-dense, exuberant and full of natural energy. He never over ripens and seems completely unconcerned that he is incapable of frowning or touching the top of his partially peeled head. As far as brand mascots go, he has the perfect life in the sun. Social media habits evolve, however, even among produce ambassadors. Said William Goldfield, Dole Food Company‚Äôs director of communications: ‚ÄúAfter years of meeting banana lovers in-person at supermarkets, festivals, fairs and special events, Bobby wants to expand connection with his millions of fans. He‚Äôs heard about the networking benefits of LinkedIn so decided to join the cyber-community to share company news and rally even more kids and their parents to adopt a heathier diet and lifestyle. And what better time to launch his new page than today‚Äôs National Banana Day?‚Äù Bobby will use his new LinkedIn page to share updates on Dole fruit business, discuss sustainability initiatives, promote banana usage and suggest produce-rich recipes, serving suggestions and entertaining ideas. He will educate followers about Dole‚Äôs campaigns, farming operations and hunger-relief efforts and program events. Bobby‚Äôs LinkedIn followers will be the first to hear about his public appearances, meet-and-greets and banana meet-ups across the country. Introduced to the world by Dole in early 1990s to put a bright, optimistic face on healthy living, Bobby Banana spends most of his time promoting smarter eating habits and active lifestyles at schools, supermarkets and special events throughout the country. He took center stage in 2024 as the host of Dole‚Äôs ‚Äú125 th Banana-Versary, a year-long celebration of the produce leader‚Äôs quasquicentennial¬†year in the banana business. As part of the festivities, Bobby was inducted into the Dole Banana Hall of Fame and honored with his own display at the National Mascot Hall of Fame. To see Bobby Banana‚Äôs LinkedIn profile and follow him, go to https://www.linkedin.com/in/bobby-banana-003636360/ . Bobby‚Äôs new LinkedIn presence expands a large Dole social media universe that includes Dole Food Company pages on Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, TikTok and LinkedIn totaling close to 2 million followers. About Dole plc Dole plc, is one of the world‚Äôs largest producers and marketers of high-quality fresh fruit and fresh vegetables. Operating in more than 70 countries, Dole is an industry leader in many of the products it sells, as well as in nutrition education. For more information, please visit www.dole.com . In the U.S., Dole was ranked as the most-trusted brand in Fresh Fruit and Salad Kits in the 2025 BrandSpark Most-Trusted Brand Awards Presented by Newsweek as determined by more than 29,000 American shoppers who shared their insights on which brands they trust most and why. ### Share this post on facebook twitter pinterest email print Media Contact Bob Ochsner bob@sophiaschoice.com (949) 233-0984 Company Careers Press Releases Code of Conduct Transparency in Coverage Dole Family Dole Fruit Hawaii Dole Packaged Foods Ocean Cargo Dole Pineapple Farm Tour Business Partner DBCP Facts Memorandum of Insurance Transparency in Supply Chain Management Truckers & Customers Information Portal Investors Dole plc Follow us Facebook Instagram Pinterest X US US Choose a different Language Close English (United States) Deutsch (Deutschland) English (Canada) English (United Kingdom) Italiano (Italia) Nederlands (Nederland) Greek (Greece) English (United States) Deutsch (Deutschland) English (Canada) English (United Kingdom) Italiano (Italia) Nederlands (Nederland) Greek (Greece) Continue reading Back to the top ¬© 2025 All rights reserved. Het succes is direct terug te zien in de statistieken. Door Wesley Hegge De knalgele bananen toveren meteen een lach op je gezicht. Maar het vrolijke beeldmerk zegt ook iets belangrijks over de werkwijze van de start-up. ‚ÄúWij cre√´ren online content vanuit doelstellingen en strategische keuzes en gaan vanuit dit uitgangspunt operationeel aan de slag. Wij maken de banaan open vanuit de achterzijde en niet vanuit de steel‚Äù, legt Sjoerd Lormans uit. ‚ÄúDat maakt het online verschil.‚Äù Strategie vertalen naar content Samen met Niek Bastiaens en Jules Jongerius geeft hij leiding aan Social Banana. De twintigers hebben de ontwikkeling van Hyves tot Instagram van dichtbij meegemaakt. Social media kent voor hen geen geheimen. Ze merkten dat veel ondernemers daarentegen niet goed weten hoe ze social media in kunnen zetten. Daarom zijn ze een half jaar geleden een bedrijf begonnen. ‚ÄúWe nemen het uit handen‚Äù, zegt Niek. ‚ÄúZodat ondernemers zich kunnen focussen op hun core business. Onze klanten vari√´ren van zzp‚Äôers tot kleine en middelgrote bedrijven die zich bevinden in de driehoek Maastricht-Eindhoven-Nijmegen.‚Äù Social Banana onderscheidt zich door niet alleen de strategie in kaart te brengen, maar ook de uitvoering op zich te nemen. Een team vertaalt de online strategie naar tekstuele en visuele content. Jules: ‚ÄúDat team bestaat uit een fotograaf, webdesigner, twee grafisch ontwerpers en vier social media marketeers. Wij maken de content gereed en passend voor ieder kanaal. Content voor Facebook is anders dan voor Instagram.‚Äù Het is voor elke ondernemer interessant om online gezien te worden. Daarom kan elke ondernemer zijn voordeel doen met het laten plaatsen van online content. Sjoerd: ‚ÄúSommige ondernemers denken in omzet, maar het doel kan ook op een ander niveau liggen. Bijvoorbeeld om je te profileren richting klanten. Online succes begint voor ons bij naamsbekendheid, bereik en een juiste positionering. De ondernemer ontvangt statistieken zodat de groei kan worden bijgehouden. De rest doen wij.‚Äù Transparantie Dat begint al bij het kennismakingsgesprek. Jules: ‚ÄúWe bespreken de mogelijkheden en nemen onze abonnementen door. Daarin staat precies wat de ondernemer krijgt. Het aantal posts per maand, statistieken en evaluatie. De abonnementen zijn gevarieerd, waardoor we zowel kleine als grote mkb‚Äôers kunnen bedienen. We kunnen zelfs een website, logo en huisstijl maken.‚Äù Tussendoor laat Social Banana de ondernemers zien hoe de statistieken bewegen. ‚ÄúWe houden zelf voortdurend de statistieken in de gaten‚Äù, zegt Niek. ‚ÄúZo zien we of we op de goede weg zijn of misschien moeten bijsturen. Dat laten we de ondernemer ook zien, zodat hij of zij ziet wat er gebeurt. Daarbij evalueren we samen met de ondernemer de resultaten.‚Äù Wil je weten wat Social Banana voor jou als ondernemer kan betekenen? Kijk dan op onze website en doe de gratis Facebook-check! Christina Newberry September 4, 2025 10 min read Also available in Espa√±ol Deutsch Fran√ßais Table of Contents Quick social media image sizes Instagram image sizes X (f.k.a. Twitter) image sizes Facebook image sizes LinkedIn image sizes Pinterest image sizes Snapchat image sizes YouTube image sizes TikTok image sizes Bluesky image sizes Threads image sizes Social media image sizes seem to change ‚Ä¶ a lot. Never mind the confusion of new social platforms emerging, with their own content specs and aspect ratios. It doesn‚Äôt help that information about official dimensions and image sizes is surprisingly scarce. So what‚Äôs the big secret? The lack of official image guidelines is likely directly tied to the frequency of image guideline changes. The platforms don‚Äôt want to invest the time and energy to constantly update their image guidelines for end users. Fortunately, dear reader, we have invested that time and energy for you to create this comprehensive (and up-to-date) cheat sheet listing social media image sizes on all important social media platforms! Below are the most recent social media image dimensions, as of September 2025. Quick social media image sizes We go into more detail for every single network below, but this image includes the social media image sizes you probably look up most often. Basic Instagram image sizes Profile photo: 320 x 320 px Landscape: 1080 x 566 px Vertical: 1080 x 1350 px Square: 1080 x 1080 Stories and Reels: 1080 x 1920 Basic Facebook image sizes Profile photo: 196 x 196 px Landscape: 1080 x 566 px Vertical: 1080 x 1359 px Square: 1080 x 1080 px Stories and Reels: 1080 x 1920 px Cover photo: 851 x 315 px Basic X (formerly Twitter) image sizes Profile photo: 400 x 400 px Landscape: 1280 x 720 px Vertical: 720 x 1280 px Square: 720 x 720 px Cover photo: 1500 x 500 px Basic LinkedIn image sizes Profile photo: 400 x 400 px Landscape: 1200 x 627 px Vertical: 720 x 900 px Square: 1200 x 1200 px Cover photo: 1128 x 191 px Basic TikTok image sizes Profile photo: 20 x 20 px Landscape (ad): 1920 x 1080 px Vertical: 1080 x 1920 px Square (ad): 640 x 640 px Stories: 1080 x 1920 px Instagram image sizes Instagram supports horizontally and vertically oriented images well as square images. Well, sort of. You can still use all of these photo orientations in your posts, and that‚Äôs how they‚Äôll appear in the Instagram feed. But they will all be displayed with a vertical crop on your Instagram grid. This makes image dimensions a little tricky to get right, especially if you want to control the look of your grid as a cohesive whole. Follow these guidelines to make sure your images end up looking their best. Instagram profile picture size: 320 x 320 pixels Instagram profile photos are displayed at 110 x 100 pixels, but the image files are stored at 320 x 320 pixels, so make sure to upload an image that‚Äôs least that big. Even though the dimensions are in a square format, Instagram profile photos are displayed as a circle. Make sure any elements you want to focus on in the photo are centered so they don‚Äôt get cropped out. Instagram post sizes: Landscape image: 1080 x 566 pixels (feed) / 1012 x 1350 (grid) Vertical image: 1080 x 1350 pixels (feed) / 1012 x 1350 (grid) Square image: 1080 x 1080 pixels (feed) / 1012 x 1350 (grid) Carousel images: 1080 x 1350 pixels (feed) / 1012 x 1350 (grid) Supported aspect ratios: Anywhere between 1.91:1 and 4:5 (feed) / 3:4 (grid) Recommended image size: Width of 1080 pixels, height between 566 and 1350 pixels Tips: If you want your images to look their best on Instagram, aim to upload an image that is 1080 pixels wide. When you share an Instagram image that‚Äôs sized over 1080 pixels, Instagram will size it down to 1080 pixels. If you share a photo that has a resolution lower than 320 pixels, Instagram will size it up to 320 pixels. If your image is between 320 and 1080 pixels wide, Instagram will keep that photo at its original resolution, ‚Äú as long as the photo‚Äôs aspect ratio is between 1.91:1 and 4:5 (a height between 566 and 1350 pixels with a width of 1080 pixels).‚Äù If you upload an image using a different ratio, the platform will automatically crop your photo to fit a supported ratio. Remember that all photos appear in vertical format on your grid. Resource: Learn how to edit Instagram photos like a pro . Instagram Stories image size: 1080 x 1920 pixels This is an aspect ratio of 9:16. The ‚Äúsafe area‚Äù is 1080 x 1610 pixels. Make sure to keep important content within that area of the frame. Resource: Take your Instagram Stories to the next level with these free templates . Instagram Reels sizes: 1080 x 1920 pixels (feed) / 1080 x 1440 pixels (grid) The feed aspect ratio is 9:16, while the grid view is 3:4. Instagram ads image sizes: Landscape: 1080 x 566 pixels Vertical: 1080 x 1350 pixels Square: 1440 x 1440 pixels Minimum width: 500 pixels Minimum height: 400 pixels Supported aspect ratios: Anywhere between 1.91:1 and 4:5 Image size for Instagram Stories ads: 1440 x 2560 pixels This is a 9:16 ratio. Instagram recommends leaving roughly ‚Äú14% (250 pixels) of the top and 20% (340 pixels) of the bottom of the image free from text, logos, or other key creative elements‚Äù to prevent them from being covered. Instagram Reels ads size: 1440 x 2560 pixels This is a 9:16 ratio. Instagram recommends leaving roughly ‚Äú14% of the top, 35% of the bottom, and 6% on each side ‚Ä¶ free from text, logos, or other key creative elements‚Äù to prevent them from being cropped or covered. X (f.k.a. Twitter) image sizes With its new video tab, X is clearly embracing a multimedia experience on the platform. Adding images to your X posts can help you stand out from the crowd. Pssst: This isn‚Äôt a video size post, but we will tell you that the recommended aspect ratio for the new X video tab is 9:16 with a minimum resolution of 720 x 1280. X (Twitter) image sizes for profile photos: 400 x 400 (recommended) Maximum file size: 2 MB. X header photo size: 1500 x 500 pixels (recommended) The way header images display changes depending on the monitor and browser being used. Even with the recommended dimensions, 60 pixels can be cropped from the top and bottom. X images sizes for in-stream photos: Landscape image: 1280 x 720 pixels Vertical image: 720 x 1280 pixels Square image: 720 x 720 pixels GIF: 1280 x 1080 pixels Tips Recommended aspect ratio: 16:9 or 1:1 Supported formats: GIF, JPG and PNG Maximum file size: Up to 5MB for photos and GIFs on mobile. Up to 15MB on the web. X image sizes for ads: Image ad with app buttons, website buttons, or polls: 800 x 418 pixels (1.91:1) or 800 x 800 (1:1) pixels. Square images in ads with polls will crop to 1.91:1 in mobile timeline. Image ad with conversation buttons: 800 x 418 pixels (1.91:1). All images in the carousel must use the same aspect ratio. Collection ads: 800 x 800 pixels (1:1), max 3 MB. Resource: Find more information here on how to advertise on X (Twitter) . Facebook image sizes Facebook is a tricky platform, because image sizes differ from desktop to mobile, and Facebook users are inclined to use both. (Facebook.com is the world‚Äôs third-most popular website .) We‚Äôve got you covered on both fronts here. Facebook profile picture size: 196 x 196 pixels (recommended) Display size desktop: 176 x 176 pixels. Display size smartphone: 196 x 196 pixels. Use the recommended pixel sizes for the fastest load times. Profile pictures and cover photos with logos or text work best when uploaded as a PNG file. Don‚Äôt drag to reposition once you‚Äôve uploaded your cover photo. Resource: Get more tips on creating a great Facebook Page . If you choose a different aspect ratio, know that these Pins are cropped from the middle. Collections can also be an ad format on Pinterest. Pinterest image sizes for ads: Image and Shopping ads: 1000 x 1500 pixels (recommended). Aspect ratio 2:3 (recommended). Max file size 20 MB. Carousel ads: 1000 x 1500 pixels (2:3) or 1000 x 1000 pixels (1:1) recommended. Up to 5 images. Resource: Get some advice on how to use Pinterest for business . Snapchat image sizes Snapchat profile picture size: 320 x 320 pixels (minimum) Maximum file size is 2 MB. Snapchat banner image size: 375 x 278 pixels (recommended) You can upload an image up to 375 x 569 pixels, but it will crop to 375 x 278 Maximum file size: 2 MB Snapchat ads image size: 1080 x 1920 pixels (at minimum) Aspect ratio: 9:16 File type: JPEG or PNG Maximum file size: 5 MB Tips Don‚Äôt put any important content in the top 150 px or bottom 330 px, to make sure it won‚Äôt be covered. Resource: Learn how to use Snapchat for business . YouTube image sizes YouTube profile photo size: 800 x 800 pixels (recommended) Tips Make sure the focus of your photo is centered for best results. Maximum file size is 15 MB. Photos will render at 98 x 98 pixels. YouTube banner image size: 2 560 x 1 440 pixels ( recommended ) Aspect ratio: 16:9 Minimum dimensions 2048 x 1152 At the minimum dimensions, the safe area for text and logos to avoid being cut off is 1235 x 338 pixels Maximum file size: 6 MB YouTube video thumbnail size: 1280 x 720 pixels (recommended) Minimum width is 640 pixels Max file size if 2 MB Use a 16:9 aspect ratio YouTube podcast playlist thumbnail size: 1280 x 1280 pixels (recommended) Use a 1:1 aspect ratio Maximum file size: 10 MB Tips You can‚Äôt upload a custom thumbnail for Shorts, but you can select which frame from the video to use as the thumbnail. Resource: How to create a YouTube channel . TikTok image sizes TikTok profile photo size: 20 x 20 pixels (minimum size to upload) We recommend uploading a higher quality photo for future-proofing. TikTok video size: 1080 x 1920 ( recommended ) The ideal aspect ratio for vertical TikTok videos is 9:16. You can post videos with other dimensions, but the platform will add black bars to the top and bottom of the videos so they are full-screen. TikTok ads image sizes: Vertical (recommended): 540 x 960 pixels minimum (9:16) Landscape: 960 x 540 pixels minimum (16:9) Square: 640 x 640 pixels minimum (1:1) Carousel: 1200 x 628 pixels or 640 x 640 pixels or 720 x 1280 pixels. 2 to 35 images. Recommended max file size 100 KB. Profile photo for ads: 98 x 98 pixels (1:1). Max file size 50 KB. Resource: How to get more views on TikTok Bluesky image sizes Bluesky profile picture size: 1000 x 1000 pixels Upload a 1:1 profile photo with the most important part of the image in the center. It crops to a circle. Bluesky banner image size: 3000 x 1000 pixels Bluesky renders the banner image differently on desktop and mobile, so it‚Äôs a good idea to check different formats to make sure it looks right on each one. Keep the important information in the center. Bluesky image post size: 1000 pixels (height or width) There is no set image size for Bluesky, but the platform stores image files with the longest side at 1000 pixels. Stick with standard image sizes like 1:1, 9:16, 3:4, or 4:5 for best results. Tips Each post can have up to four images. Each image is limited to 1 MB. Resource: How to use Bluesky for business . Threads image sizes Threads profile image size: 640 x 640 pixels Like most other social platforms, the profile image is cropped to a circle. Threads post image size: 1440 x 1920 (recommended) Minimum width: 320 pixels Maximum width: 1440 pixels Acceptable aspect ratio: 0.01:1 to 10:1. Native aspect ratio is 3:4 Maximum file size: 8 MB Tips Carousel posts can include up to 20 images. Resource: How to use Threads effectively in 2025 Why is it important to get social media image sizes right? Social media marketers need to get many things right when creating visual content for social media. You‚Äôve got to make sure the images you use comply with copyright laws . If you don‚Äôt have original imagery, you‚Äôve got to find high-quality stock photos . And you‚Äôve got to figure out how to create images that connect with your audience and inspire them to take action. On top of that, you‚Äôve got to get your social media image sizes right. That‚Äôs really important because: It avoids pixelation and awkward image stretching to keep your images looking professional. Photos optimized for each social channel‚Äôs feed can help increase engagement. Incorrect sizing could cut off some of your brand‚Äôs messaging. It can future-proof your content. Using the right social media image sizes now could mean less work for your brand in the future, when networks change up how images display yet again. When building posts in Hootsuite, you never have to worry about getting the image size wrong. You can upload and refine your images using Canva‚Äôs editing tools right inside the Hootsuite dashboard. The very first step of the process is selecting a network-optimized size for your image from a drop-down menu. Here‚Äôs how it works: Log in to your Hootsuite account and head to Composer . Click on the purple Canva icon in the bottom right corner of the content editor. Select the type of visual you want to create. You can pick a network-optimized size from the drop-down list or start a new custom design. When you make your selection, a login pop-up window will open. Sign in using your Canva credentials or follow the prompts to start a new Canva account. (In case you were wondering ‚Äî yes, this feature does work with free Canva accounts!) Design your image in the Canva editor. When you‚Äôre done editing, click Add to post in the top right corner. The image will automatically be uploaded to the social post you‚Äôre building in Composer. Don‚Äôt feel like memorizing all this info? Easily resize your social media images for publication through Hootsuite Composer, which includes up-to-date image dimensions for every social media network.
